hero.headline: Colour Done Right
hero.subheading: Transform your look with rich, dimensional colour. From subtle enhancements to bold transformations—expertly crafted for you.

overview.title: Choose Your Colours
overview.subtitle: From subtle enhancements to bold transformations, we offer a complete range of colouring techniques.

types.title: Full Head Colour
types.description: Complete colour application from roots to ends. Perfect for dramatic changes or refreshing faded colour throughout.

types.title: Creative Colours
types.description: Bold, creative colours including pastels, vivids, and unique shades. Express your personality with standout colour.

types.title: Airtouch
types.description: Seamless blending using air for the most natural-looking blonde.

types.title: Ombré Colour
types.description: Gradual transition from darker roots to lighter ends. Creates a modern, dimensional look with built-in grow-out.

types.title: Highlights
types.description: Add dimension and brightness with strategically placed lighter strands.

types.title: Blondes & Silvers
types.description: Expert bleaching and toning for the perfect platinum or cool silver.

types.title: Gray Blending
types.description: Strategic colour placement that softens gray coverage for a natural, low-maintenance look with dimension.

types.title: Root Touch-Up
types.description: Colours only new growth (1-2 inches at roots). Ideal for maintaining your existing colour between full applications.

steps.title: Consultation
steps.description: We discuss your colour goals, assess your hair's current condition, and recommend the perfect shade. We'll show you swatches and discuss maintenance.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: For first-time clients or significant changes, we perform a strand test. Your hair is then prepared and protected for the colouring process.

steps.title: Application
steps.description: Your colorist applies the custom-mixed formula with precision, ensuring even coverage from roots to ends for optimal brilliance.

steps.title: Processing
steps.description: The colour develops for the optimal time based on your hair type and desired result. We monitor to ensure perfect colour development.

steps.title: Finish
steps.description: Your hair is gently rinsed, followed by a color-sealing treatment and optional toner. We finish with a professional blow-dry and style.

tips.title: Wait Before Washing
tips.text: Avoid shampooing your hair for at least 48 hours after coloring. This allows the dye to fully set, locking in vibrancy and reducing early fading.

tips.title: Use Color-Safe Products
tips.text: Switch to sulfate-free, color-safe shampoo and conditioner. These gentle formulas help preserve your new color and maintain hair health.

tips.title: Limit Heat Styling
tips.text: Minimize use of hot tools like irons and blowdryers in the first week. When styling, always use a heat protectant spray.

tips.title: Deep Condition Weekly
tips.text: Apply a nourishing hair mask or deep conditioner once a week to replenish moisture and maintain shine after chemical processing.

tips.title: Protect From Sun & Chlorine
tips.text: Wear a hat outdoors to shield hair from UV rays, which can fade color. Rinse and protect hair before swimming in chlorinated pools.

tips.title: Refresh With Toner
tips.text: Consider a professional toner or gloss every 4–6 weeks to keep your color fresh and counteract brassiness or fading.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about our hair colouring services.

questions.question: How long does hair color last?
questions.answer: With proper care, professional hair color typically lasts 4-6 weeks before requiring a root touch-up. The vibrancy of the color gradually fades over 6-8 weeks. Using color-safe shampoo and conditioner can extend the life of your color significantly.

questions.question: Will colouring damage my hair?
questions.answer: Our gentle, low-ammonia Japanese formulas are designed to minimize damage while delivering beautiful results. We also include conditioning treatments to protect and nourish your hair during the colouring process. However, any chemical process does affect hair structure, which is why we recommend regular deep conditioning treatments.

questions.question: Can I color my hair if it's already been treated?
questions.answer: Yes, but we need to assess your hair's condition first. If you've recently had other chemical treatments like perms or relaxers, we may recommend waiting or using alternative colouring methods. During your consultation, please inform us of any previous treatments.

questions.question: How do I choose the right color?
questions.answer: We'll help you select the perfect shade based on your skin tone, eye color, lifestyle, and maintenance preferences. We'll show you color swatches and can perform a strand test if you're unsure. We recommend bringing inspiration photos to your consultation.

questions.question: What's the difference between root touch-up and full color?
questions.answer: A root touch-up colors only the new growth at your roots (typically 1-2 inches), perfect for maintaining your existing color. A full color service colors your entire head of hair, ideal for changing your color completely or refreshing faded color throughout.

meta.title: Hair Perm | Signature Trims
meta.description: Create lasting volume and texture with our professional perm services. Choose from Korean Digital Perms, C-Curls, S-Curls, and more.

hero.headline: Beautiful Volume That Lasts
hero.subheading: Enjoy natural-looking volume and defined texture every day, with minimal styling and months of staying power.

overview.intro: Achieve the perfect curls you've always desired with our expert perm services. Whether you have fine, straight hair or want to elevate your natural waves, we are here to bring your vision to life. We specialize in creating beautifully defined curls and waves that tailor perfectly to your style, delivering lasting texture, volume, and movement.
overview.title: Types of Perms Available
overview.subtitle: We can do a wide variety of perm styles, and help you find the best look for your face shape and lifestyle.

types.title: Regular Perm
types.description: A traditional wave technique that creates distinct, defined curls from root to tip, offering lasting texture and volume.

types.title: Digital Perm
types.description: A heat-activated styling method that produces soft, natural-looking waves which become more defined when dry, mimicking a salon blowout.

types.title: Iron Roots Perm
types.description: Focuses on lifting the roots to add height and body to flat hair without curling the mid-lengths or ends.

types.title: Fringe Perm
types.description: Targeted styling exclusively for the bangs to create a soft curve and volume, improving face-framing and simplifying daily styling.

types.title: Down Perm
types.description: A smoothing treatment designed to relax and flatten stubborn, puffy hair on the sides or back to create a slimmer silhouette.

types.title: Men's Perm
types.description: Adds movement, volume, and texture to shorter styles, ranging from subtle waves to defined curls for easier manageability.

steps.title: Consultation & Hair Analysis
steps.description: We assess your hair's history, texture, and current condition. We discuss the desired curl size, type (wave, spiral, tight curl), and choose the appropriate rod size and perming solution strength.

steps.title: Shampoo & Rod Placement
steps.description: Hair is gently cleansed without conditioning. Sections of damp hair are carefully and precisely wrapped around perm rods, which determine the final curl pattern and size.

steps.title: Perming Solution Application (Softening)
steps.description: The waving (reducing) solution—containing ingredients like ammonium thioglycolate—is applied. This solution breaks the hair's internal disulfide bonds, making the hair pliable.

steps.title: Processing & Test Curls
steps.description: The hair is left to process for a specified time. The stylist closely monitors the chemical reaction by occasionally unwrapping a test curl to ensure the new curl formation is achieved without over-processing.

steps.title: Rinsing & Neutralizer Application (Fixing)
steps.description: The waving solution is thoroughly rinsed out (often while the rods are still in). A neutralizing solution (containing hydrogen peroxide or sodium bromate) is then applied to fix the newly formed bonds, locking the curl into its shape.

steps.title: Rod Removal & Final Rinse
steps.description: After the neutralizer has processed, the perm rods are carefully removed. The hair receives a final rinse, and a deep conditioner or moisturizing treatment is applied to restore moisture and pH balance.

tips.title: The Initial Wait
tips.text: Wait a minimum of 48 to 72 hours before washing your hair or tying it up to allow the chemical bonds in the curls to fully set and prevent them from dropping.

tips.title: Gentle Detangling
tips.text: Only use a wide-tooth comb or your fingers to gently detangle the hair. Avoid using fine brushes, which can pull the curls out and cause unnecessary frizz.

tips.title: Curl-Friendly Drying (Digital Perms)
tips.text: For digital perms, gently twist sections of your hair while blow-drying (using a diffuser attachment is best) to reinforce and enhance the spiral shape of the new curls.

tips.title: Styling & Product Application
tips.text: Apply moisturizing and curl-enhancing products (like mousse, cream, or gel) to damp hair. Avoid brushing after application. Air-dry or use a diffuser on low heat.

tips.title: Frizz Reduction while Sleeping
tips.text: Sleep on a silk or satin pillowcase. This material creates less friction, significantly reducing frizz and helping to maintain the curl definition overnight.

tips.title: Use Right Products (Sulfate/Alcohol-Free)
tips.text: Commit to using only sulfate-free and alcohol-free shampoo and conditioner. Sulfates strip the hair's natural oils and can weaken the perm, causing the curls to relax prematurely.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about our perm services.

questions.question: How long does a perm last?
questions.answer: A perm lasts 6-8 months on average, though results vary based on hair growth rate, texture, and how you care for it. The curls will gradually loosen over time but remain until you cut the permed hair off or grow it out. Digital perms tend to last slightly longer due to the heat-setting process.

questions.question: What's the difference between a digital perm and classic perm?
questions.answer: A digital perm uses heated rods and creates loose, natural-looking waves that mimic heat-styled curls. It works best on medium to long hair. A classic (cold) perm uses room-temperature rods and creates more defined, tighter curls that are springier when wet. Digital perms tend to look more natural and modern.

questions.question: Can I perm colored or bleached hair?
questions.answer: It's possible, but we need to carefully assess your hair's condition first. Perming already chemically-treated hair carries higher risk of damage. We typically recommend waiting 2-3 weeks between coloring and perming, and may suggest strand tests or bond-building treatments. Very damaged or over-processed hair may not be suitable for perming.

questions.question: Will a perm damage my hair?
questions.answer: Perming is a chemical process that alters hair structure, so some stress is inevitable. However, using quality Korean or Japanese perm solutions, proper technique, and post-perm care minimizes damage. We don't recommend perming severely damaged hair. Regular deep conditioning treatments will help maintain hair health.

questions.question: How do I style permed hair?
questions.answer: The beauty of a perm is minimal styling! After washing, apply curl-enhancing mousse or cream to damp hair, scrunch upward, and either air-dry or diffuse on low heat. Avoid brushing dry permed hair (use fingers or a wide-tooth comb). Refresh curls between washes with a spray bottle and curl cream.

cta.title: Ready for Effortless Curls?
cta.description: Book a perm consultation to explore curl options. We'll help you choose the perfect texture for your lifestyle.

meta.description: Achieve sleek, pin-straight hair or soft volume with our professional rebonding services. Long-lasting, frizz-free results.

hero.headline: Silky Smooth Sleekness
hero.subheading: Achieve permanently straight, glossy hair that lasts for months. Say goodbye to daily styling and hello to sleek perfection.

overview.intro: Transform unruly, wavy, or frizzy hair into silky-smooth perfection with our professional hair rebonding services. Whether you desire pin-straight strands or simply want easier-to-manage hair, we use advanced techniques to deliver lasting results.
overview.title: Choose Your Finish
overview.subtitle: Not all straight hair is the same. Customize your look with our specialized techniques.

types.title: Hair Rebonding
types.description: Ultra-straight finish with smoothness for a sleek, polished look.

types.title: Roots Rebonding
types.description: Targeted straightening for newly grown, wavy roots without over-processing the rest of your hair.

types.title: Fringe Rebonding
types.description: Specialized straightening for your bangs. Achieve face-framing fringe while maintaining natural texture in the rest of your hair for a stylish look with minimal commitment.

steps.title: Hair Analysis & Consultation
steps.description: We assess your hair's texture, previous treatments, and overall condition to determine the best rebonding formula and technique.

steps.title: Relaxer Application
steps.description: A carefully selected straightening cream is applied section by section to break down natural bonds. Formula strength is customized to your hair type.

steps.title: Processing & Monitoring
steps.description: The relaxer processes while we closely monitor straightening progress. This critical step requires expert timing to achieve smooth results.

steps.title: Blow-Dry & Flat-Iron
steps.description: After thorough rinsing, your hair is precision blow-dried to 100% straight. Each section is carefully flat-ironed at controlled temperature.

steps.title: Neutralizer Application
steps.description: A neutralizing solution is applied to rebuild and lock hair bonds in their new straight formation for long-lasting results.

steps.title: Final Styling & Treatment
steps.description: After a final rinse, we apply a nourishing treatment to restore moisture. Your hair is styled to showcase the sleek finish.

aftercare.title: Aftercare Tips
aftercare.note: Rebonding is permanent on the treated hair. You will only need to touch up the roots as they grow out.

tips.title: The 72-Hour Rule
tips.text: Do not wash, wet, or tie your hair for 3 full days after rebonding to allow the bonds to fully set.

tips.title: Sleep Smart
tips.text: Sleep on a silk or satin pillowcase and keep hair completely straight while sleeping.

tips.title: Avoid Creases
tips.text: Avoid tucking hair behind ears or using hair clips in the first 72 hours—any bends will set permanently.

tips.title: Use Right Products
tips.text: Use only sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner formulated for chemically treated hair.

tips.title: Deep Condition Weekly
tips.text: Apply a deep conditioning mask weekly to maintain moisture and prevent dryness.

tips.title: Minimize Heat
tips.text: Minimize heat styling; when necessary, use low heat settings with heat protectant.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about our rebonding services.

questions.question: How long does rebonding last?
questions.answer: Rebonding results are permanent on the treated hair. As your hair grows, you'll see natural texture at the roots, typically requiring a root touch-up every 6-8 months. The straightened portions will remain straight until you cut them off or grow them out.

questions.question: Can I color my hair after rebonding?
questions.answer: We recommend waiting at least 2-3 weeks after rebonding before coloring your hair, as both are chemical processes that can stress hair. Ideally, color your hair 1-2 weeks before your rebonding appointment. Consult with us to create the safest sequence for your hair goals.

questions.question: Is rebonding damaging to hair?
questions.answer: Rebonding is a chemical process that does alter hair structure, so some stress to the hair is inevitable. However, using premium formulas like Shiseido or Mucota, proper technique, and post-treatment care significantly minimizes damage. We don't recommend rebonding on very damaged, over-processed, or extremely fragile hair.

questions.question: What's the difference between rebonding and keratin treatment?
questions.answer: Rebonding chemically alters hair structure for permanently straight results, while keratin treatments are temporary (3-5 months) and reduce frizz without making hair pin-straight. Rebonding creates straighter results but is more of a commitment, while keratin is gentler and more reversible.

questions.question: What should I avoid after rebonding?
questions.answer: For the first 3 days: no washing, no tying hair up, no clips/headbands, no tucking behind ears, and sleep on a silk pillowcase. After 3 days, avoid high heat styling, chlorinated water, and tight hairstyles. Always use sulfate-free products formulated for chemically treated hair.

cta.description: Ready for permanently straight hair? Book a rebonding consultation to discuss your straightening goals and hair condition.

meta.description: Achieve silky, frizz-free hair with our professional keratin smoothing treatments. Long-lasting shine and manageability.

hero.headline:
Frizz-Free.
Effortlessly Smooth.
hero.subheading: Transform unmanageable hair into silky perfection. Our premium keratin treatments reduce styling time and boost shine.

why.title: Why Keratin Treatment?
why.subtitle: Frizz, unruliness, and lack of shine often result from damaged cuticles and humidity. Our keratin treatments smooth the hair shaft and lock in moisture.

items.title: Frizzy & Unmanageable
items.solution: Smooths the hair cuticle to eliminate frizz and reduce volume.

items.title: Styling Difficulty
items.solution: Reduces blow-dry time by up to 50% and makes styling effortless.

items.title: Damaged/Porous Hair
items.solution: Fills in gaps in the hair cuticle with protein for strength and shine.

items.title: Humidity Sensitivity
items.solution: Creates a protective barrier that blocks out humidity and prevents puffiness.

items.title: Hair Treatment (Normal)
items.description: Professional surface conditioning treatment using cream-based conditioners. Provides immediate moisture boost through heat-activated penetration, ideal for weekly maintenance and quick hydration without long-term commitment.

items.title: Shiseido Treatment (Japan)
items.description: Premium Japanese reconstruction therapy using Shiseido's Double Repair System and Hair Reform Technology. Targets the inner hair cortex to restore the cross-sectional shape of damaged strands, mimicking the hair's natural moisture barrier.

items.title: Mucota Treatment (Japan)
items.description: Advanced Japanese treatment designed specifically for Asian hair types, featuring rich Argan oil and Cell Membrane Complex (CMC). Uses molecular layering technique to penetrate different hair depths, creating a protective veil that locks moisture inside.

items.title: K-Gloss Keratin (USA)
items.description: Water-based hybrid formula combining keratin and collagen, that fills hair porosity to eliminate frizz while maintaining natural volume. Delivers instant gloss without forcing hair flat.

items.title: Tiboli Keratin (USA)
items.description: Elite smoothing system using patented Trioxxy® protein blend for intense straightening and frizz control. Forms a protective protein shield over each strand that physically holds hair in a smoother, straighter position.

steps.title: Consultation
steps.description: We assess your hair texture, porosity, and damage level to determine the ideal keratin formula for your needs.

steps.title: Clarifying Wash
steps.description: A specialized deep-cleansing shampoo removes all residue and opens the hair cuticle for maximum absorption.

steps.title: Application
steps.description: The keratin treatment is applied section by section, ensuring every strand is completely saturated.

steps.title: Processing & Drying
steps.description: After the formula sets, we blow-dry the hair to lock in the treatment and prepare it for sealing.

steps.title: Heat Sealing
steps.description: We use a flat iron at a precise temperature to seal the keratin into the cuticle, creating a smooth, glossy finish.

tips.title: Wait 72 Hours
tips.text: Do not wash, tie, or pin your hair for 3 days. This allows the keratin to fully set and bond with your hair.

tips.title: Sulfate-Free Only
tips.text: Always use sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner. Sulfates strip the keratin coating and shorten the treatment's lifespan.

tips.title: Avoid Salt Water
tips.text: Salt water and chlorine can erode the treatment. Rinse hair with fresh water before swimming and apply a leave-in conditioner.

tips.title: Silk Pillowcase
tips.text: Sleeping on a silk or satin pillowcase reduces friction, helping to maintain smoothness and prevent frizz while you sleep.

faq.title: Keratin Treatment FAQs
faq.description: Common questions about our keratin smoothing services.

questions.question: How long does keratin treatment last?
questions.answer: Keratin treatments typically last 3-5 months, gradually fading over time as you wash your hair. Unlike rebonding, keratin doesn't create a harsh regrowth line—it simply reverts to your natural texture. Results last longer with sulfate-free products and less frequent washing.

questions.question: What's the difference between keratin treatment and rebonding?
questions.answer: Keratin is a temporary smoothing treatment (3-5 months) that reduces frizz and adds shine while maintaining some natural movement. Rebonding is a permanent chemical straightening process that creates pin-straight hair lasting 6-8 months with only root regrowth. Keratin is gentler and more reversible, while rebonding is more dramatic and permanent.

questions.question: Can I get keratin treatment on colored or bleached hair?
questions.answer: Yes! Keratin treatment is actually beneficial for colored or bleached hair, as it helps seal the cuticle and restore smoothness. We recommend waiting 1-2 weeks after coloring for best results. The treatment can help extend color vibrancy by reducing porosity.

questions.question: Will keratin treatment make my hair completely straight?
questions.answer: No—keratin reduces frizz and smooths hair but doesn't eliminate curls or waves entirely. You'll retain natural movement and body, just in a more controlled, polished form. If you want completely straight hair, rebonding would be more appropriate.

questions.question: What should I avoid after keratin treatment?
questions.answer: For the first 3 days, avoid washing hair, tying it up, or using clips/headbands. After that, use sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner, minimize heat styling, and avoid chlorinated water. These precautions help extend the life of your treatment.

questions.question: How is your keratin treatment different from at-home products?
questions.answer: Professional keratin uses higher-quality formulas with controlled application and heat-sealing techniques that ensure even distribution and longer-lasting results. At-home treatments lack the professional heat-sealing step and often provide more temporary results (4-6 weeks vs. 3-5 months).

why.title: Why Scalp Care Matters
why.subtitle: Issues like oiliness, dandruff, and hair loss often stem from a clogged or unbalanced scalp. Our treatments deep cleanse and nourish the follicles.

items.title: Oily Scalp

items.title: Hair Loss
items.solution: Stimulates blood circulation and strengthens roots to reduce shedding.

items.title: Sensitive/Itchy

items.title: Dandruff & Flaking

items.title: Regular Scalp Treatment

steps.description: We begin with a thorough scalp analysis using a microscopic scanner to identify your specific condition and needs.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: A gentle brushing stimulates blood flow and loosens debris, preparing your scalp for deep cleansing.

steps.title: Deep Cleansing
steps.description: We apply a specialized pre-shampoo treatment to exfoliate and dissolve buildup, followed by a purifying wash.

steps.title: Treatment Application

tips.title: Avoid Washing for 24h

tips.title: Use Gentle Products

tips.title: Watch Water Temperature
tips.text: Wash with lukewarm water. Hot water can strip moisture and trigger oil production, while cold water may not cleanse effectively.

tips.title: Protect from Sun
tips.text: Your scalp may be more sensitive after exfoliation. Wear a hat or use SPF hair products if spending time outdoors.

faq.title: Scalp Treatment FAQs
faq.description: Common questions about our scalp care services.

questions.question: How often should I get a scalp treatment?
questions.answer: For maintenance and general scalp health, we recommend monthly treatments. If addressing specific concerns like severe dandruff, excessive oiliness, or hair loss, you may benefit from bi-weekly treatments for the first 4-6 weeks, then transitioning to monthly maintenance.

questions.question: Will scalp treatment help with hair loss?
questions.answer: While scalp treatments can't reverse genetic hair loss, they create optimal conditions for hair growth by improving blood circulation, removing buildup that blocks follicles, and delivering nutrients to the scalp. Many clients notice improved hair thickness and reduced shedding with regular treatments. For significant hair loss concerns, we recommend consulting a dermatologist.

questions.question: Is scalp treatment suitable for sensitive scalps?
questions.answer: Yes! We can customize treatments specifically for sensitive scalps using gentle, soothing formulas without harsh ingredients. Let us know about your sensitivity during consultation so we can select the most appropriate products and techniques.

questions.question: Can I get a scalp treatment if I have colored hair?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Scalp treatments focus on the scalp and roots rather than the hair lengths, and we use color-safe products. In fact, scalp treatments can help maintain color vibrancy by creating a healthier environment for hair growth and reducing the need for harsh clarifying shampoos.

questions.question: What's the difference between regular and advanced scalp therapy?
questions.answer: Our regular Scalp Treatment provides deep cleansing and general scalp health maintenance using quality formulas. The Advanced Scalp Therapy uses premium formulas specifically targeting concerns like hair loss, severe dandruff, or extreme oiliness, and includes optional treatment ampoule boosts for intensified results.
